title: Philip Rivers to start at quarterback for Colts on Sunday
snippets: Philip Rivers, who came out of retirement this week to help the Colts address their void at quarterback, is expected to start Sunday against the Seahawks, a source told ESPN.
Over four years after his last snap, Philip Rivers has been elevated from the Indianapolis Colts practice squad to the team's active roster to start against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday.
It’s once again Phillip Rivers’ time under centre for the Indianapolis Colts.
In a shocking turn of events, the 44-year-old will lead the offense just days after joining the team

summary: Philip Rivers, 44, has come out of retirement and been elevated from the Indianapolis Colts practice squad to the active roster. He is expected to start at quarterback for the Colts against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday, just days after rejoining the team. This marks his first NFL game in over four years.

title: Gunman kills two US soldiers and interpreter in Syria patrol
snippets: US Central Command said two service members and a civilian were ambushed by a lone "Islamic State" gunman in central Syria. It is the first deadly incident involving US forces since Bashar Assad was ousted last year.
A joint U.S.-Syrian security patrol was attacked in the city of Palmyra, the Pentagon and Syria’s state news agency said.

Two soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed while supporting counterterror operations, the Pentagon said. They are the first U.S. casualties in Syria since the fall of the dictator Bashar al-Assad.
Trump Vows Retaliation After US Soldiers Killed in Syria Bloomberg.com
The attack on U.S. troops in Syria is the first to inflict casualties since the fall of President Bashar Assad a year ago.
Three U.S. military personnel — two army soldiers and a civilian interpreter — were killed on Saturday after an attacker targeted a convoy of American and Syrian forces, the U.S. military said.

This is the first deadly incident involving U.S. forces in Syria since the ouster of Bashar al-Assad last year. Former President Trump has vowed retaliation following the attack.

title: Connor McDavid scores twice as Oilers win over Maple Leafs
snippets: Connor McDavid had two goals and an assist as the Edmonton Oilers thumped the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-3 on Saturday.
Connor McDavid and Vasily Podkolzin scored two goals each and Leon Draisaitl supplied three assists as the Edmonton Oilers defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-3.

Blake Coleman potted a shorthanded goal in the second, and Morgan Frost tallied the overtime winner as the Calgary Flames downed the Los Angeles Kings 2-1. Adrian Kempe picked up the lone goal for the Kings in the loss.
J.T. Miller buried a pair of goals including the overtime winner, while Noah Laba and Will Cuylle each had a goal and an assist to help the New York Rangers beat the Montreal Canadiens 5-4.

Tyler Pitlick scored his first of the year, Jesper Wallstedt made 34 saves and Joel Eriksson Ek buried the game-winning goal with 22 seconds left to help the Minnesota Wild beat the Ottawa Senators 3-2.

Gabriel Vilardi scored a pair of goals, Josh Morrissey tallied two assists, and Connor Hellebuyck made 24 saves in his return to the net as the Winnipeg Jets secured a 5-1 win over the Washington Capitals.
Emil Heineman sniped the deciding goal in the shootout and Ilya Sorokin made 32 saves to help the New York Islanders top the Tampa Bay Lightning in a 3-2 win.

Tyler Toffoli netted two goals and a pair of assists, Macklin Celebrini had three points and John Klingberg buried the game-winning goal in overtime to help the San Jose Sharks complete the comeback and beat the Pittsburgh Penguins 6-5.
Nathan MacKinnon scored and added an assist, Scott Wedgewood made 27 saves and Victor Olofsson buried the game-winning goal to lead the Colorado Avalanche past the Nashville Predators 4-2.
Brad Marchand potted two goals to increase his team-leading total to 18, while Anton Lundell and Sam Reinhart each tallied two points, as the Florida Panthers earned a 4-0 win over the Dallas Stars.

Alex DeBrincat tallied two goals and an assist while Patrick Kane added two points of his own as the Detroit Red Wings earned a 4-0 win over the Chicago Blackhawks. John Gibson stopped all 26 shots for his second shutout in his last three games.

Seth Jarvis picked up his team-leading 18th goal of the season, while Shayne Gostisbehere chipped in with two assists, as the Carolina Hurricanes earned a 4-3 shootout win over the Philadelphia Flyers. Trevor Zegras notched two points in the loss.

Ben Hutton and Brayden McNabb each potted goals in the third period to lift the Vegas Golden Knights to a 3-2 comeback victory over the Columbus Blue Jackets. Mitch Marner tallied an assist on all three goals in the win.

title: Victor Wembanyama helps Spurs beat Thunder and reach NBA Cup final
snippets: Victor Wembanyama and San Antonio progress to the NBA Cup championship game after beating the defending NBA champions.

Victor Wembanyama returned from a 12-game absence with 22 points and nine rebounds, giving San Antonio a surge and the Oklahoma City Thunder just its second loss with the 111-109 victory Saturday night putting the Spurs in the NBA Cup final.
titles: Wembanyama, Spurs stun OKC Thunder to make NBA Cup final
Wembanyama’s return lifts Spurs to NBA Cup final, hands Thunder second loss
constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.35 (<12 tokens)
summary: Victor Wembanyama scored 22 points and had nine rebounds in his return from a 12-game absence, helping the San Antonio Spurs defeat the defending NBA champions 111-109. The win advances San Antonio to the NBA Cup championship game and gives the Oklahoma City Thunder only their second loss of the season.

title: England coach says team will keep same batters for next match
snippets: Head coach Brendon McCullum says England are unlikely to make changes to their batting line-up for the crucial third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

England head coach Brendon McCullum has hinted at an unchanged batting line-up for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide while brushing off questions that his job could be on the line if the tour of Australia spirals out of control.
titles: No batting changes for vital Ashes Test - McCullum
McCullum suggests England will name unchanged batting line-up in Adelaide
constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.35 (<12 tokens)
summary: England head coach Brendon McCullum has indicated that the team will likely keep the same batting line-up for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide. McCullum also dismissed concerns about his job security, despite speculation over England's performance on the Australia tour.

title: Drone attack in Sudan kills six UN peacekeepers and hurts eight
snippets: The strike on a United Nations base in the southern Kordofan region was the deadliest single episode for the body’s personnel in Sudan’s civil war.

UN secretary general António Guterres says ‘unjustifiable’ attack on base in city of Kadugli ‘could be war crime’ A drone strike has hit a United Nations peacekeeping logistics base in war-torn Sudan, killing six peacekeepers, the UN secretary general António Guterres has said. Eight other peacekeep
titles: Six U.N. Peacekeepers Killed in Drone Strike in Sudanese Battle Zone
Drone strike on UN facility in war-torn Sudan leaves six peacekeepers dead
constructiveness_reason: This story provides basic awareness about a drone strike in a Sudanese battle zone. However, it does not provide any deeper understanding, actionable insights, or report on solutions or attempts to solve the problem.
summary: A drone strike hit a United Nations peacekeeping logistics base in Kadugli, southern Kordofan, Sudan, killing six peacekeepers and injuring eight others. UN Secretary General António Guterres condemned the attack as "unjustifiable" and stated it "could be a war crime." This was the deadliest incident for UN personnel in Sudan's ongoing civil war.

title: US seizes oil tanker near Venezuela carrying Iranian oil
snippets: U.S. unseals warrant behind oil tanker seizure near Venezuela Axios
The tanker was headed eastward and had recently carried Iranian oil. The seizure is an escalation in President Trump’s military pressure campaign against Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro.
titles: U.S. unseals warrant behind oil tanker seizure near Venezuela - Axios
What to Know About Trump’s Seizure of an Oil Tanker Near Venezuela

summary: U.S. authorities have unsealed a warrant related to the seizure of an oil tanker near Venezuela. The tanker, which was traveling east and had recently transported Iranian oil, was intercepted as part of efforts to increase pressure on Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro. The action reflects an escalation in U.S. measures targeting oil shipments linked to Iran and Venezuela.

title: Five men arrested in Germany for planning Christmas market attack
snippets: The five men are suspected of planning an Islamist-motivated attack on a Christmas market in southern Germany, the Munich public prosecutor's office said.
Local media says one of the suspects is an imam at a mosque, and police allege he "called for a vehicle attack".

Local media report that one suspect is an imam at a mosque and is alleged by police to have called for a vehicle attack. The investigation is ongoing.
